message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about how dogs regulate their body temperature. Dogs do not have sweat glands like humans do, so they cannot sweat to cool down. Instead, they pant, which helps to evaporate moisture from their tongues and respiratory system, helping to cool them down. Option (B) is incorrect because finding water may help a dog cool down, but it is not directly related to the process of temperature adjustment. Option (C) is incorrect because dogs do not sweat like humans do. Option (D) is a play on words and not related to temperature regulation in dogs.
